title: Calories in a Vodka Tonic Drink
meta_description: Discover calories in a vodka tonic drink, including carbs from tonic, alcohol content, and variations like diet tonic for lower calories.
h1: Calories in a Vodka Tonic Drink
assumptions: Standard recipe: 1.5 oz (44 ml) vodka, 4 oz (120 ml) tonic water, lime wedge; no added sugar or syrup.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by vodka brand, tonic type, pour size, and mix ratio. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard vodka tonic has ~180 kcal, mostly from alcohol and tonic sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use diet tonic instead of regular

faqs.q: How many calories in a vodka tonic drink?
faqs.a: About 180 kcal for a standard 1.5 oz vodka and 4 oz tonic mix.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a vodka tonic?
faqs.a: Yes, ~20 g carbs from the tonic water's sugars; vodka adds none.
Switch to diet tonic to drop to ~100 kcal, with 0 g sugars.

faqs.q: Does vodka tonic have protein or fat?
faqs.a: No protein or fat; calories come from alcohol (vodka) and carbs (tonic).

faqs.q: How does tonic type affect calories in vodka tonic drink?
faqs.a: Regular tonic adds ~80-100 kcal from sugars; diet or soda water keeps it under 100 kcal.
